abstract: On Wednesday, the company reported net income of $2.38 billion, or $1.01 a share, compared with $1.06 billion, or $0.42 a share in the same three-month period a year earlier.
snippet: On Wednesday, the company reported net income of $2.38 billion, or $1.01 a share, compared with $1.06 billion, or $0.42 a share in the same three-month period a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: 8:54 p.m. | Updated Strong growth at News Corporation’s cable channels FX, Fox News and regional sports networks helped the company more than double its net income in the three-month period that ended Dec. 31, offsetting lingering costs related to a phone-hacking scandal and the cost of a planned split of the media conglomerate into two publicly traded companies.

headline.main: News Corp. Posts Gain on Strength of Cable Channels
headline.print_headline: Cable Helps News Corp. Post Gains
